result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillippe R. Beaudin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Phillippe R. Beaudin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Phillippe R. Beaudin was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Phillippe R. Beaudin in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moved to amend count 1 to County ord. Disorderly conduct.  Court grants motion.  Defendant entered plea of nc.  Court finds defendant guilty fine of $519.50 given 60 dtp and counts 2 and 3 are dismissed.

APPEARANCES:  Defendant Phillippe R. Beaudin in court with Attorney Thomas W Duffy.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint.  Court enters NOT GUILTY plea to Counts 1, 2, and 3 on behalf of DE.  

Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
DEF appears in court by video from custody.  Bruce Poquette appears for the State of WI.  Court orders bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for 1-27-15 @ 8:30 am.

No abusive Contact with Doreen Wolfe-
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "Doreen Wolfe" or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
No consumption of alcoholic beverages.
